titleZh: MODEM：用于恶劣天气图像恢复的 Morton 顺序退化估计机制
titleEn: MODEM: A Morton-Order Degradation Estimation Mechanism for Adverse Weather Image Recovery
authors: Hainuo Wang, Qiming Hu, and Xiaojie Guo*
summaryZh: 面向恶劣天气视觉恢复，提出 Morton 顺序退化估计机制，显著提升重建质量。
summaryEn: Morton-order degradation modeling delivers high-quality restoration in severe weather conditions.

titleZh: 面向真实场景文字的扩散式图像超分辨框架
titleEn: Text-Aware Real-World Image Super-Resolution via Diffusion Model with Joint Segmentation Decoders
authors: Qiming Hu, Linglong Fan, Yiyan Luo, Yuhang Yu, Qingnan Fan, and Xiaojie Guo*
summaryZh: 联合分割解码器保持真实场景文字的高保真细节，显著提升可读性。
summaryEn: Joint segmentation decoders in a diffusion framework preserve text fidelity in real-world scenarios.

titleZh: Practical Video Object Detection via Feature Selection and Aggregation
titleEn: Practical Video Object Detection via Feature Selection and Aggregation
authors: Yuheng Shi, Tong Zhang, and Xiaojie Guo*
summaryZh: 通过特征选择与时序聚合稳固视频目标检测，使其在真实部署中保持高效与稳定。
summaryEn: Feature selection and aggregation strengthen video object detection under practical deployment constraints.

titleZh: ShadowHack: Hacking Shadows via Luminance-Color Divide and Conquer
titleEn: ShadowHack: Hacking Shadows via Luminance-Color Divide and Conquer
authors: Jin Hu, Mingjia Li, and Xiaojie Guo*
summaryZh: 利用亮度-色彩拆分策略分步处理，精确控制阴影的生成、编辑与消除。
summaryEn: A luminance-color divide-and-conquer strategy enables controllable shadow editing and removal.

titleZh: Reversible Decoupling Network for Single Image Reflection Removal
titleEn: Reversible Decoupling Network for Single Image Reflection Removal
authors: Hao Zhao, Mingjia Li, Qiming Hu, and Xiaojie Guo*
summaryZh: 可逆结构解耦反射与主景，保持细节的同时完成单幅图像反射去除。
summaryEn: A reversible decoupling framework securely removes reflections while preserving fine scene details.

titleZh: Domain Adaptive Object Detection via Differential Alignment
titleEn: Domain Adaptive Object Detection via Differential Alignment
authors: Xinyu He, Xinhui Li, and Xiaojie Guo*
summaryZh: 差分对齐策略精准匹配源域与目标域分布，提升跨域目标检测的泛化能力。
summaryEn: Differential alignment bridges source-target discrepancies to boost domain adaptive object detection.
